article.title: Installing Xopus
article.introduction: You can download Xopus from http://xopus.com (Use Ctrl+Click to open). We recommend always working with the latest version, as we are constantly improving our product.
article.paragraph: In the download you can find five folders. These folders should be placed in an folder on your webserver in such a way that you can access xopus/xopus.html from your server.
Alternatively, by including xopus.js in a file, Xopus will be loaded around that file when opened in a browser.

section.title: Config
section.paragraph: The config folder contains configuration files, and javascript files that are loaded by default. This folder currently does not exist with Xopus 4.

section.title: Examples
section.paragraph: In the examples folder you can find several examples that show you different features of Xopus.

section.title: License
section.paragraph: This folder contains the license keys for Xopus. By default the localhost and 127.0.0.1 files are present.

section.title: Resources
section.paragraph: This folder is used to the dictionary files. It is not always present in the download, but the dictionaries can be downloaded seperately from http://xopus.com.

section.title: Xopus
section.paragraph: This folder contains xopus.html and xopus.js, and several other files which form the core of Xopus.
